core_meaning.normalized_summary: Endurance. Right constancy — holding to correct principle over time — creates stable success. This is not blind stubbornness or clinging. It's living in a way that can last. If you force permanence too fast, or you try to lock in something that isn't true, it turns toxic. If you cultivate steady character and appropriate loyalty, you become structurally reliable, and that reliability can move through the world.

lines.normalized_meaning: Inconsistency in character gets exposed. People notice when you can't hold your own standard. Even doubling down defensively brings shame.

lines.normalized_meaning: Effort without result. You keep showing up, but there's nothing to harvest here. Constancy in the wrong place gives you an empty field.

lines.normalized_meaning: Loyal, steady devotion in a receptive/support role is blessed. But if a leader clings in the same rigid way, it becomes weakness. Constancy must fit the role.
